intro: Bothriocline laxa subsp. mbalensis, commonly known as the Mbalé daisy, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has erect, branching stems and hairy leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native environment. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to other subspecies of Bothriocline laxa.
